item.title: Brian add a quote by Sylvia Plath
item.description: "I can never read all the books I want; I can never be all the people I want and live all the lives I want. I can never train myself in all the skills I want. And why do I want? I want to live and feel all the shades, tones and variations of mental and physical experience possible in life. And I am horribly limited." -- Sylvia Plath

item.title: Brian add a quote by William Strunk/E.B. White
item.description: "Instead of announcing what you are about to tell is interesting, make it so." -- William Strunk/E.B. White

item.title: Brian add a quote by Ray Bradbury
item.description: "We all are rich and ignore the buried fact of accumulated wisdom." -- Ray Bradbury

item.title: Brian add a quote by David Allen
item.description: "Your mind is for having ideas, not holding them." -- David Allen

item.title: Brian add a quote by Nikos Kazantzakis
item.description: "I should learn to run, to wrestle, to swim, to ride horses, to row, to drive a car, to fire a rifle. I should fill my soul with flesh. I should fill my flesh with soul. In fact, I should reconcile at last within me the two internal antagonists." -- Nikos Kazantzakis

item.title: Brian add a quote by haruki murakami
item.description: "Pain is inevitable. Suffering is optional." -- haruki murakami

item.title: Brian add a quote by Rumi
item.description: "When you go through a hard period, When everything seems to oppose you, ... When you feel you cannot even bear one more minute, NEVER GIVE UP! Because it is the time and place that the course will divert!" -- Rumi

item.title: Brian add a quote by John Kennedy Toole
item.description: "...When my brain begins to reel from my literary labors, I make an occassional cheese dip." -- John Kennedy Toole
